54.heading: Hucksters.
54.title: Pinocchio [videorecording]
54.author: [No author]
notes: Title on container: Walt Disney's Masterpiece Pinocchio.
Based on the story by Carlo Collodi.
Videocassette release of the 1940 animated film by Walt Disney Productions.
Directors, Ben Sharpsteen, Hamilton Luske ; story adaptation, Ted Sears, et al. ; animation, Jack Campbell, et al. ; music and lyrics by Leigh Harline, Ned Washington, Paul J. Smith.
Characters: Pinocchio, Jiminy Cricket, Geppetto, J. Worthington Foulfellow, Monstro.

Summary (from OCLC): A puppet wants to be a boy. A fairy promises boyhood to Pinocchio if he can prove he is kind, honest and loving. A wayward huckster tries to lead the puppet astray but Pinocchio decides to perform a redeeming act of bravery and kindness.

69.heading: Hudgins, Joseph.
69.title: Flesh Gordon [videorecording]
69.author: presented by Hen's Tooth Video and by Mammoth Films.
notes: First issued 1974 as a motion picture.
Cast: Jason Williams, Suzanne Fields, Joseph Hudgins, William Hunt, John Hoyt as Professor Gordon.

Summary: "In this popular outrageous spoof of sci-fi films, Earth is thrown onto carnal chaos by a mysterious sex ray emanating from outer space. Flesh Gordon, Dale Ardor and their new found friend Dr. Flexi Jerkoff, must travel to the planet Porno to save Earth from certain devastation by the mad Emperor Wang. Includes 10 minutes of previously unseen footage and original trailer.
"This program contains mature subject matter. It is intended for viewing by adult audiences, 18 years and older."

114.heading: Hudson, Mike.
114.title: "May Riot Becomes Comic Strip Fodder : Students, Faculty Members React to Sunday Cartoon"
114.author: by David Hall and Mike Hudson
114.appears_in: p. 1-2 in The State News, v. 94, no. 112 (Aug. 17, 1998).
notes: Article in Michigan State University's student newspaper reacts to Doonesbury strip of August 16, 1998 about the "beer riots at Michigan State." University president Peter McPherson and vice-president Terry Denbow both consider the strip as having negative impact.
